colorTheory.description: A color theme strictly using only the colors extracted from the PDF: #A0695F, #666666, #45A29E, #FFFFFF, #616161, #667C68, #D06D52, #998684, #7F5FA0, #4B7F52, #333333, #4C4C4C, #3A7CA5, #6644BB. Following Derrida's philosophy of deconstruction, we've preserved the original colors without introducing external elements.
colorTheory.harmony: The colors are arranged to establish clear contrasts between primary and secondary elements, while accent colors disrupt traditional hierarchies.
colorTheory.contrast: Binary oppositions between text (#333333) and background (#FFFFFF) create meaningful contrast that emphasizes legibility and guides the user's attention. Primary (#333333) and secondary (#666666) colors establish a clear hierarchy of interactive elements.
colorTheory.accessibility: The color choices prioritize visibility and legibility, enhancing the user experience and guiding attention effectively.
